newsitem.title: USA: Objective Systems drops on earnings warning.
newsitem.headline: Objective Systems drops on earnings warning.

text.p: Shares of Objective Systems Integrators Inc dropped about 46 percent after the company warned it would post a third quarter loss due to slowdowns in the competitive local exchange carrier market and the personal communications systems market.
Objective Systems, which develops networking software and tools, dropped 3-25/32 to 4-9/32 in heavy trading.
The Folsom, Calif.-based company also attributed part of the projected third quarter shortfall to a delay in finalizing some customer contracts at the end of the third quarter.

Objective Systems said late Monday that it expects to post a loss of between $0.16 and $0.18 a share on revenues of about $10 million, compared with earnings of $0.06 a share on revenues of $13.8 million last year.
Morgan Stanley also downgraded the stock to neutral from outperform.
Although Objective Systems had problems with a contract being delayed, Morgan Stanley said it believes Objective Systems' backlog increased sequentially from its "modest" levels at the year-end.
Morgan Stanley also said it could take one or two quarters before customers began deploying in significant volumes Objective Systems' NetExpert Release 3.5, which became available on March 31.
